page.title: 19Village Institute in Well
page.content: Dominoes & snooker are played indoors but quoits is played at the back and a team competes in the Lower Dales Quoits League. {Quoits as played in Well}- This ancient outdoor game peculiar to N.Eng. is played between 2 teams of 7 players.Rules vary from region to region.Simple equipment is needed,viz iron rings 8" across, central hole 5" diam and bevelled on 1 side - 2 iron stakes (hobs) 3" high,33' apart set in mud patches 3' square. Object is to toss a quoit standing 6' in front of 1 hob and ring opposite hob,or place quoit nearer hob than opponent. {Procedure}- players from opposing teams pair up.Using 2 quoits per man,1st pair play.First player gaining 21 points wins. {Scoring}- Quoit nearest hob 1 point, hob ringed 2 points.
